text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Mordechai approves plan to build thousands of Jewish homes between Jerusalem and Maaleh Adumim
- Investigators haven't decided whether to question Rabbi Yosef
- Israeli Bar shelved ethics committee decision to press charges against bar head Hoter-Yishai over comments against Supreme Court
- IDF pullback tied to Palestinian reaction to Har Homa
- New investigation: who leaked cabinet meeting minutes?
- Inquiry into helicopter crash to decide today who should be warned
- Shock at communications ministry: appointment of Turbevich as Bezeq head quashed
- Commander of Tel-Nof air base, fleet commander indirectly responsible for helicopter crash, air force chief says in testimony
- Investigation source: there are findings Deri wanted to appoint a sympathetic attorney-general
